document_title: Right heart failure: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_content:
Right heart failure is a condition in which the right ventricle does not pump blood effectively to the lungs. In other words, the right ventricle is weakened, causing it to not pump enough blood to the lungs. This disease often occurs when the left ventricle weakens, losing its ability to pump blood to the rest of the body. Or it can be due to a number of diseases, including pulmonary hypertension due to many causes, right ventricular cardiomyopathy and valvular heart disease... (1)
Right-sided heart failure is also known as cor pulmonale or cor pulmonale.
